Title: feat: Payment Contracts V2
Author: aviv-augustinjuricic
Review_Comments: aviv-ziyadmuhammed: Thanks for making the changes. Overall very complete contract with useful descriptions on all fields! Some general remarks 1. I prefer to call this contract v1 and remove current v1 contract and cases completely. They were never used. 2. The path of all the files should be src/YOUR_CAPABILITY_CODE/... @aviv-julienjehannet please help on this. 3. We are missing some crucial info on scheduling, the write mode etc. I will align with Julien on this. 4. All fields are marked as mandatory. Is this the expected behaviour? 5. In the example/case files, use a real world example so that it is clear for consumers. Of course, change the traceable ids, if any.

Title: feat:PII Feature
Author: aviv-fathallahelmasri
Review_Comments: copilot-pull-request-reviewer[bot]: ## Pull Request Overview Adds support for annotating fields with a PII sensitivity level and propagating that metadata through JSON and Avro schemas. - Introduce a `PIILevel` field annotation class with validation for allowed levels. - Export `PIILevel` in the public API and include it in Avro metadata mappings. - Add a new test to verify that `PIILevel` annotations produce the correct schema entries. ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 4 out of 4 changed files in this pull request and generated 2 comments. | File | Description | | ------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------- | | src/aviv_data_collection_lib/contract.py | Define `PIILevel` class and validation logic. | | src/aviv_data_collection_lib/__init__.py | Export `PIILevel` in `__all__`. | | src/pydantic_avro/to_avro/custom.py | Add `"PIILevel"` to Avro custom metadata list. | | tests/test_contract_annotations.py | New `test_pii_level_annotation` to verify schemas. | <details> <summary>Comments suppressed due to low confidence (2)</summary> **src/aviv_data_collection_lib/contract.py:53** * [nitpick] Add a docstring to `PIILevel` explaining its purpose and listing valid levels for future maintainers. ``` __slots__ = ("Critical", "High", "Regular") ``` **tests/test_contract_annotations.py:138** * Consider adding a separate test that passes an invalid level (e.g., `PIILevel("Low")`) to verify that a `ValueError` is raised as expected. ``` def test_pii_level_annotation(self): ``` </details>

Title: feat: create paused handler for uncompliant contracts
Author: aviv-julienjehannet
Review_Comments: copilot-pull-request-reviewer[bot]: ## Pull Request Overview This pull request introduces a new paused handler to bypass processing of noncompliant contracts and makes several adjustments across testing, schema generation, and file system modules. Key changes include the removal of legacy test and modeling handler files, modifications to schema documentation propagation and platform validation in contracts, and the addition of the PausedHandler along with updates to the main deployment flow. ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 11 out of 12 changed files in this pull request and generated 1 comment. <details> <summary>Show a summary per file</summary> | File | Description | | ------------------------------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------- | | tests/modeling/test_handlers.py | Removed legacy test file for modeling handlers. | | src/pydantic_avro/to_avro/types.py | Enhanced documentation propagation by reusing enum class docs. | | src/aviv_data_collection_lib/handlers.py | Added multiple new handlers (PausedHandler, StatisticsHandler, etc.). | | src/aviv_data_collection_lib/fs.py | Introduced contract collection enhancements in fs utility. | | src/aviv_data_collection_lib/decorators.py | Added a paused decorator with reason validation. | | src/aviv_data_collection_lib/contract.py | Updated caching, table naming and modified platform error handling.| | src/aviv_data_collection_deployment/main.py | Updated handler ordering and integration in the main deploy script.| | src/aviv_data_collection_deployment/glue_registry.py | Streamlined logger initialization and adjusted draft mode reset. | | src/aviv/data/modeling/handlers.py | Removed legacy modeling handler code. | | src/aviv/data/modeling/fs.py | Removed legacy fs file for modeling. | | .poethepoet/aws.toml | Updated AWS-related tasks and command configurations. | </details> <details> <summary>Comments suppressed due to low confidence (1)</summary> **src/aviv_data_collection_lib/contract.py:313** * Replacing an exception raise with a print statement in the platform() method may lead to silent failures. Consider restoring the exception to ensure invalid platform names are properly handled. ``` print(f"'{platform}' isn't a valid data platform name", self.origin) ``` </details>

Martinique, etc. <details> <summary>Comments suppressed due to low confidence (2)</summary> **src/aviv/commons/codesets/territory.py:1** * Commented-out assertions are not executed; to ensure the new ISO alpha-2 territory mappings are validated, move these examples into a proper test module so they run as automated tests. ``` # assert Country("BL").short_name == "Saint Barthélemy" ``` **src/aviv/commons/codesets/territory.py:1** * [nitpick] Rather than leaving usage examples as commented-out assertions, consider consolidating them into docstrings or external documentation (e.g., README) for clarity and maintainability. ``` # assert Country("BL").short_name == "Saint Barthélemy" ``` </details> | copilot-pull-request-reviewer[bot]: ## Pull Request Overview This PR adds support for ISO alpha-2 country and language codes in the common codesets and introduces a UUID v5 type in the data modeling module. - Expose a new `UUID5` type alongside `UUID4` - Alias `CountryAlpha2` and `LanguageAlpha2` as `Country`/`Language` in commons codesets - Add newsfragments documenting these new capabilities ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 7 out of 7 changed files in this pull request code support | | src/aviv/commons/newsfragments/+i18n.added | Document ISO 639-1 alpha-2 language code support | | src/aviv/commons/codesets/territory.py | Alias `CountryAlpha2` as `Country` | |
